attributes.action: Tackle the empty homes before building new homes
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: There are currently around 750,000 empty residential properties all around the UK. These can house between 2-2.5 million people. Instead of the govt building on greenfield sites and reducing our countryside, they should tackle these first. Empty houses makes an area unattractive and is a magnet for anti-social behaviour/crime. For any property which is deemed 'unsafe', the property is knocked down and a house is built in its place. Plus if the govt does something with the empty homes, then it uses fewer carbon emissions than building from scratch.

rejection.details: There is a similar petition at: http://petitions.pm.gov.uk/emptyhomes/
reasons: Duplicate - this is similar to and/or overlaps with an existing petition or petitions
